Package bin.main.Gene_Main

Class GeneCreation

  • java.lang.Object
    • bin.main.Gene_Main.GeneCreation
  • public class GeneCreation
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods to test certain systems within the actual program. Includes tools to check validity of gene sequences, and generate a random gene with a chosen number of pairs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GeneCreation()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static void check_if_Possible​(char[] sequence)
      Tests whether a sequence is a proper gene sequence.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeneCreation

        public GeneCreation()

    • Method Detail

      • check_if_Possible

        public static void check_if_Possible​(char[] sequence)
                              throws GeneCreationError
        Tests whether a sequence is a proper gene sequence. If the gene sequence given is not a valid sequence, the program will output an INVALID_CHARACTER error.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence to be tested.
        Throws:
        GeneCreationError - Throws an INVALID_CHARACTER error if there is an invalid character in the sequence.

      • randomGene

        public static java.lang.String randomGene​(int size)
        Creates a random gene with a given number of pairs.
        Parameters:
        size - The number of pairs in the created gene.
        Returns:
        A string containing the randomly generated gene.
